knimeNode.name: SMOTE
knimeNode.shortDescription: Oversamples data using the SMOTE algorithm by Chawla et. al.

fullDescription.intro:
Oversamples data using the
SMOTE (Synthetic Minority Over-sampling Technique) algorithm by Chawla et al. The algorithm creates synthetic examples for classes of interest by extrapolating between a real sample of the class and one of the sample's neighbors. The paper describing this technique is available online at
http://www.cs.cmu.edu/afs/cs/project/jair/pub/volume16/chawla02a.pdf.
fullDescription.option: Pick the column that contains the class information.

An option that determines how many nearest neighbors shall be considered. The algorithm picks an object from the target class, randomly selects one of its neighbors and draws the new synthetic example along the line between the sample and the neighbor.

Checking this option oversamples each class equally. You need to specify how much synthetic data is introduced, e.g. a value of 2 will introduce two more portions for each class (if there are 50 rows in the input table labeled as "A"; the output will contain 150 rows belonging to "A").
This option adds synthetic examples to all classes that are not the majority class. The output contains the same number of rows for each of the possible classes.

ports.dataIn: Table containing labeled data for oversampling
ports.dataOut: Oversampled data (input table with appended rows).
